main_text:
Fechner’s philosophy is characterized by a clash between his
metaphysical interests and his positivist proclivities. His
metaphysical interests led him toward panpsychism: the doctrine that
the universe is created and governed by mind or the soul; his
positivist leanings led him to uphold an early version of
verificationism and phenomenalism. Fechner insisted that there was no
disparity between these tendencies, that the best scientific evidence
supported the view that the universe is psychic. His philosophy of
mind is an early form of neutral monism.
